data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3012598,"name":"Santiago Sepúlveda","username":"Sepu2002","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c67d28/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-24T23:17:55.018Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eIs there a way to use the CTRE mag encoders with the falcon 500s? The only encoders we could get a hold of were the regular mag encoders and noticed that the data interfaces were different. We know the encoders have solder pads on the back, and they share the same pinout as the falcon’s port but aren’t sure if this’ll work because the port on the falcon is labeled as a limit switch interface.\u003cbr\u003e\nIf we could do this my follow up is regarding how to implement this into LabVIEW.\u003cbr\u003e\nThanks in advance\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2022-02-24T23:17:55.018Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":218,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":1115.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":403899,"topic_slug":"using-mag-encoders-with-falcon-500-motors","display_username":"Santiago Sepúlveda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51602,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/using-mag-encoders-with-falcon-500-motors/403899/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3012624,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-25T00:02:30.015Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eFalcon 500s cant have an encoder plugged in to the port, since, as you noticed, it is for limit switches only. However, Falcons have an encoder built in that can be used for onboard feedback. If you need a sensor external to the motor (on the output shaft rather than the motor input shaft), your best options are to a) use your existing CTRE mag encoders wired to the roborio using \u003ca href=\"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-4398.html\"\u003ethis breakout board or similar\u003c/a\u003e, or b) if you really need feedback directly to the Falcon for motion magic or onboard pid, use a \u003ca href=\"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-8200.html\"\u003eCANcoder\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2022-02-25T00:02:30.015Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":118,"readers_count":117,"score":98.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":403899,"topic_slug":"using-mag-encoders-with-falcon-500-motors","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-4398.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Talon SRX Encoder Breakout Board -
